summary: Dependency vulnerability report: nyc-test-coverage-1.4.3 contains transitive dependencies with critical security vulnerabilities (loader-utils 1.4.0 with CVE-2022-37601 CVSS 9.8 and CVE-2022-37603 CVSS 7.5). Issue was auto-closed after vulnerability was marked as ignored or removed from inventory.
userImpact: Users are exposed to critical prototype pollution and ReDoS vulnerabilities in test coverage tooling that could compromise build security.
rootCause: Transitive dependency loader-utils 1.4.0 contains prototype pollution vulnerability in parseQuery() and ReDoS vulnerability in interpolateName().
proposedFix: Upgrade loader-utils to v2.0.4 or v3.2.1 (or v1.4.2 for the ReDoS fix). Update nyc-test-coverage dependency.
resolutionDetails: Issue auto-closed by Mend bot after vulnerable library was marked as ignored or removed from inventory.
keyQuote: Prototype pollution vulnerability in function parseQuery in parseQuery.js in webpack loader-utils 2.0.0 via the name variable in parseQuery.js.
